title: ★☆★☆ Fridays Only - URF ★☆★☆
body:
I think that if we made URF available only on Fridays, it would tone back most harassment and meta-pushing because it's only up one day of the week (and the most fun day of the week, too.)

Give people a reason to stay home playing League on a Friday.

No one will rage because it's only up for 1 day of the whole week.

No one will ask for it back when they know when they are able to play it.

No meta will be created because no one should really care. It's just one day out of every week.

It still requires them to make sure it works after every patch, and it will take up resources every Friday, which really limits what else you can do.  I like the idea too, but I think these are the main reasons they don't have it available all the time.

And a meta would still form.

Yeah, the main problem is the amount of resources this game mode takes up, it's very hard to maintain it. Fun mode, but it just makes everything else stop. It would be nice if it stayed as an April's fool mode each year, though, but I don't know how difficult it would be even like that.
well its been like that for 2 years so far soooooooo...

I can understand not wanting the extra workload but my argument for this kind of thing is that they'll dedicate resources to keep Howling Abyss working (and it has its own queue, items, and whatnot).

I can't stand arams so in my eyes it's disappointing that they won't give the same type of attention to a game mode that's much more fun, in my opinion. Unfortunately the player base being splintered by another game mode is probably something they want to avoid, and the huge number of players might just be in part because the game mode is only available 3 weeks or so every year.

It's a shame, but if it was that big a deal to me I would just hunt for WTF mode games in Dota (does dota 2 have wtf mode yet?) 
Till then I'll just log in to League when URF is available and let it sit for the other 49 weeks a year.

I predict that it takes a lot more work to keep URF online than it does for ARAM.  Reason being that all champions work the same in ARAM and SR, the extra work of making sure there are no bugs in URF would be significant.  If they chose to try to balance URF, it would be a ton more work than ARAM.

But you know, I've actually been hearing a lot of the opposite. Players seem to be having a lot of fun playing urf and there have been a lot of people trying to get RIOT to make URF all-year round.  I've also been invited to more URF games then other types of games and I've almost always been willing to accept.
As much as I love URF, I have to say, I'm glad that RIOT isn't making URF permanent.  I just feel that if URF were permanent, then players would start to take it seriously.  URF should not be taken seriously and we should mercilessly poke fun at anyone who actually does.
